title: Everything and Beyond
content:
if you were a book 
I'd read each page twice
Would go beyond the words
In that book of paradise. 

if you were the night sky
I'd count all the stars 
Would look at the moon
And consider you art. 

And if you were a song
I'd pay attention to the lyrics 
The melody and beauty
Ignoring the critics. 

If you were a rose,
I would keep you inside my dairy
I'm afraid your divine fragrance 
could Ruin me entirely. 

And if you were the silence 
I'd look for words in it.
But You'll be the peace
Beacuse silence is peaceful i admit. 

If you were a river
I'd come and flow with you
I'd let you drown me
All in that water blue. 

If you were rain 
I'd let you touch each part of me
And if you were the rainbow
I would reflect the colors of thee. 

Of Everything, if you were
I would have been a part of you i know it
But if you were a poem,
I would have been the poet.
author: Tamanna

content: And once the celebrations fade, even the roses crumble to dust too.
author: Tamanna

content: You scratch your scars often and wonder why they never heal, until your wounds bloom into a galaxy of injured dreams.
author: Tamanna

content: In another universe, I am 13 and I don't beg God to inject me with a fatal disease just to be loved out of pity. In another universe, love finds me without pleading.
author: Tamanna

content: The stones were once petals, the petals were once stone. It was love that changed them both.
author: Tamanna

content: I exhibit my agony in the form of my art, and you call it beautiful—this raging torment of my aching heart.
author: Tamanna

title: The Journey's Cost
content:
I die in every way my conscience permits.

The sailor who set out chasing the horizon is long dead—
not lost to the sea,
but to the journey itself.

Each wave demanded more than it returned.
Each dream, once chased, came back thinner,
heavier with hunger.

What survived was not hope, but misery—
a body still breathing,
a soul already spent.

The reason faded. The resolve eroded.
Even rebellion grew tired.

In the end, the dream did not fail—
it arrived as ash.
author: static-echoes

title: The Wager
content:
The sacrifice you made meant nothing to them.
Yet I wept—
not for your death,
but because I did not burn in your stead.

I now bear the chaos that took you from me.
I will wear it as sin, as crown, as curse.

The being that demanded your life will know flame.
Not in vengeance alone,
but in judgment—
for calling a wager a sacrifice,
and naming cruelty as necessity.

Let the realms burn if they must.
Let their thrones collapse and turn to ash,
so that the prosperity you believed in
may finally take root.

Let its flowers bloom from my remains,
nourished by a sin that ends with me.

And when the last ember fades,
I will kneel before you, my maiden—
bearing the blade myself,
so that even in death
no other hands must be stained as mine were.
author: static-echoes

content: Snow falls like a shroud, soft yet suffocating. For a moment, even ruin looks pure.
author: static-echoes

content: I sleep in the shape of absence, where even the ruin prays for the frost to finish me.
author: static-echoes

title: Ghosted Silver
content:
A tarnished oath drifts quiet through winter's breath,
Where a stoic banner folds beside a broken lance—
A melody of silence, a vow,
Whispered by ghosted silver.
author: static-echoes

title: O Noble Blade
content:
O noble blade, left upon the battlefield—
who once wielded you?

A warrior of the North, hardened by frost?
A knight bound by sacred vow?
A bandit shaped by misery?
An assassin driven by hunger?

Or was it the lords who sat upon their thrones,
bellies full and hands clean,
while angels wept upon the soil—
rotting where they fell?
author: static-echoes

content: My lore, huh? It's all stars and universes where I don't exist. That is the price. So yeah, not much of it, is it?
author: static-echoes

content: I am bad with words; I hope you are good with reading eyes.
author: Hany Mostafa Özil

content: Do not be absent for long, then come and ask about how I am. Details die with time, and stories change.
author: Mahmoud Darwish

content: My existence is a scandal.
author: Oscar Wilde

content: I am a stranger to myself that lives within me.
author: Ghani Khan

content: You still live in the silences between my thoughts.
author: D.J.

content: Your heart and my heart are very, very old friends.
author: Hafiz

content: And the writing is still: to you, with you, about you, because of you and for you.
author: Nizar Qabbani

content: Tell me every terrible thing you ever did and let me love you anyway.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

content: It takes me days to recover after a dream with you in it.
author: Unknown

content: I feel small, but so are the stars from a distance.
author: Ten Word Poem

content: I am not mine.
author: Mahmoud Darwish

content: A memory, a scar, or a stain.
author: D.J.
